execute.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to kill someone, especially legally as a punishment
execute.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: 13 people were summarily executed  (=killed without any trial or legal process) by the guerrillas.
Thousands have been executed for political crimes.
execute.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to do something that has been carefully planned
execute.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: The job involves drawing up and executing a plan of nursing care.
execute.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to perform a difficult action or movement
execute.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: The skatersâ€™ routine was perfectly executed.
execute.translation[0].definitions[3].de: if a computer executes a program or command (=instruction), it makes the program or command happen or work
execute.translation[0].definitions[4].de: to make sure that the instructions in a legal document are followed
execute.translation[0].definitions[5].de: to produce a painting, book, film etc
execute.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to do what is written in a contract, plan etc
execute.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: The directors make the decisions but the managers have to execute them.
UK companies with a proven management ability to execute a business plan
execute.translation[1].definitions[1].de: when a computer executes a program or command (=instruction), it makes the program or command work
execute.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: To make it easier, you can create a shell script to execute the program and invoke that.
